poem:
### Tariffs at Dawn

A tangled web  
of tariffs unspun,  
unwinds with a jolt  
spilling over borders—  
sharp-edged whispers  
reach across seas.  
The world's pulse stalls,  
cogs creak with disbelief;  
in the errant shadow  
of an April rise,  
tongues of steel  
find a language  
sharper than silence.
